p: Globally, the application of medicinal plants in the management of acute and chronic wounds can be considered a common occurrence in most traditional medicine practices. In view of this, many plants in the tropical and subtropical regions of the world have been screened for their wound-healing abilities [ 7, 14, 15]. Despite the growing menace of antibiotic resistance, and the fact that plants are a promising source of antibiotics with possible activity on multidrug-resistant microorganisms [ 3], the potential of plant extracts as alternative sources of novel antibiotics against wound pathogens have been under-explored, especially in developing countries. Thus, there still exists a number of medicinal plants to be screened in the search for newer, efficacious, and cost effective wound-healing properties.
